720430f-a.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park - [173rd Street - 181st Street (West).]
720430f-a.text:
Highbridge Park: A view northward of the southern extremity of this rocky area that parallels the Harlem River. The western boundary of same is Edgecombe Ave., which appears on the left. The water tower, reservoir and High Bridge are in the center of this elongated rocky slope, at the foot of West 173rd Street. North of the latter point and at the foot of West 181st Street is the Washington Bridge. These structures connect Manhattan with the Washington Heights section of the Bronx. This is a
set of three views, more or less similar.
April 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
720430f-a.folder: High Bridge Park & [173rd Street & 181st Street (West).], Manhattan, NY

720429f-b.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park - [Amsterdam Avenue.]
720429f-b.text:
(1)
Highbridge Park: The pump house, set in a hollow between High Bridge and Washington Bridge. The latter appears partially on the
right; photographers view being northward.
April 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, in the same direction and showing the general area. Buildings appearing on the left, line the western boundary of the Park,
which at this point is Amsterdam Ave.
April 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
720429f-b.folder: High Bridge Park & [Amsterdam Avenue.], Manhattan, NY

720428f-a.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park.
720428f-a.text:
High Bridge Park: An old house between High and Washington Bridges. In the background appears the apartment ridges of the Bronx on the far side of the Harlem River. This is a set of two views; No. 1 being in a southward direction and showing the structure that carries the water tubes to Manhattan. No. 2 is in the opposite direction and shows the
vehicular bond.
April 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

720428f-b.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park.
720428f-b.text:
High Bridge Park: An old house between High and Washington Bridges. In the background appears the apartment ridges of the Bronx on the far side of the Harlem River. This is a set of two views; No. 1 being in a southward direction and showing the structure that carries the water tubes to Manhattan. No. 2 is in the opposite direction and shows the
vehicular bond.
April 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

720432f-c.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park.
720432f-c.text:
Highbridge Park: A set of three views showing the former reservoir under demolition. Nos. 1 and 2 are in an eastward direction and shows the water tower silhouetted against the Washington Heights section of
the Bronx; No. 3 veering more to the south.
October 30, 1934.
Views 2 & 3:-November 5, 1934.

720433f-b.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park.
720433f-b.text:
(1)
Highbridge Park: The tower and reservoir as viewed eastward from Amsterdam Ave., at the foot of West 173rd Street. This view shows the
Nreservoir under demolition.
October 30, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same as No. 1.
Ngw
November 5, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A view of same in a westward direction as seen from the bridge
that carries the water tubes across the Harlem River.
April 6, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

720436f-a.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park - [High Bridge Tower.]
720436f-a.text:
Highbridge Park: The water tower and the bridge that bears the water tubes across the Harlem River from the Bronx.
July 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
720436f-a.folder: High Bridge Park & [High Bridge Tower.], Manhattan, NY

720437f-a.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park - Swimming pool - [High Bridge Tower.]
720437f-a.text:
High Bridge Park: An eastward view showing the swimming pool that rreplaced the former reservoir and the old water tower.
July 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
720437f-a.folder: High Bridge Park & Swimming pool & [High Bridge Tower.], Manhattan, NY

720438f-a.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park - Swimming pool.
720438f-a.text:
High Bridge Park: The new swimming pool that was constructed on the site of the old reservoir. Photographers vantage point is on Amsterdam
Ave., at Wiest 172nd Street and viewing northward.
July 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
720438f-a.folder: High Bridge Park & Swimming pool., Manhattan, NY

720425f-a.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park - [181st Street bridge.]
720425f-a.text:
High Bridge Park: The new roadway that links the Harlem River Drive (right) with the George Washington Bridge over the Hudson River. At the left is the distinctive water tower. TPe bridge that identifies this locald is in the center. Beneath same is the vehicular connection with the Bronx. This was formerly the George Vashington Bridge. It is now popularly known as the
181st Street Bridge over the Harlem River.
May 19, 1940
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
720425f-a.folder: High Bridge Park & [181st Street bridge.], Manhattan, NY

720424f-b.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park - [High Bridge Tower.]
720424f-b.text:
High Bridge Park: The High Bridge Tower and locale as viewed from various vantage points in the park. The new swimming pool
is in blose proximity to same.
June 20, 1940
Vieas 1,2,3
P. L. Snerr
720424f-b.folder: High Bridge Park & [High Bridge Tower.], Manhattan, NY

720426f-c.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park.
720426f-c.text:
High Bridge Park: Three views showing mainly the new improvements that have recently been completed. They consist of the distinctive new highway linking the Harlem River Driveway with the Hudson Rivers George Washington Bridge, and the new swimming pool. Close observatixn will disclose the latter in the center. Buildings on the left fronts on Amsterdam Avenue. Those on the right are
in the Bronx.
June 20, 1940
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr

720427f-a.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park - [173rd Street (West).]
720427f-a.text:
(1)
Highbridge Park: The water tower that is in the center of the Park (foot of West 173rd Street) as viewed northwestward from the
Harlem River, below High Bridge.
August 31, 1926.
L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, more to the west, from above the Bridge.
September 16, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, in the park. The photographers view is northward.
April 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

720431f-c.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park - [Amsterdam Avenue - 175th Street (West).]
720431f-c.text:
(1)
Highbridge Park: The baseball diamonds north of the reservoir.
Buildings shown are on the west side of Amsterdam Ave., north from West 175th Street. The 37-story frame dwelling is in the park and
is the vantage point for No. 2.
April 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Improving another diamond. This view is westward and shows HighBridge crossing to the Bronx side of the Harlem River.
October 80, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A later View, northward. Note the absence of the frame dwelling  shown in No. 1.
July 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
720431f-c.folder: High Bridge Park & [Amsterdam Avenue & 175th Street (West).], Manhattan, NY

720434f-b.title: Manhattan: High Bridge Park.
720434f-b.text:
Highbridge Park : Shown is new road construction which when completed will connect the Harlem River Drive and the George Washington Bridge. View 2 and 3 show the new elevated highway.
P. L. Sperr  View 1: 1939
No REPRODUUCTIONEE  View 2,3: 19A0
